    • addProduct

      public String addProduct(String name, String description, double price, int amount, int category) throws ObjectWithSameName, ObjectWithInvalidAmount
      This function adds a new product to a marketplace and checks for duplicate names and invalid amounts.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product being added (as a String).
      description - A String that describes the product being added.
      price - A double value representing the price of the product.
      amount - The amount parameter represents the quantity of the product being added to the inventory.
      category - The category parameter is an integer that represents the category of the product being added. The specific categories and their corresponding integer values are defined elsewhere in the code.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message. If the product is added correctly, it returns "Product Added Correctly". If there is another product with the same name, it throws an exception with the message "There is another product with the same name, please write another name for the product". If the amount is invalid, it throws an exception with the message "Please write a valid amount (amount must
      Throws:
      ObjectWithSameName
      ObjectWithInvalidAmount

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder(String nameBuyer) throws ParseException
      This function adds a new order with the given buyer name to the list of orders in the MercadoLibre system.
      Parameters:
      nameBuyer - The name of the buyer who placed the order. This parameter is used to create a new Order object and add it to the list of orders in the MercadoLibre system.
      Throws:
      ParseException

    • verifyOrder

      public void verifyOrder()
      This function removes the last order from a list if it has no products.

    • editAmountProduct

      public String editAmountProduct(int position, int newAmount) throws ObjectWithInvalidAmount
      This Java function edits the amount of a product in a marketplace and throws an exception if the new amount is invalid.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the product in the list of products (starting from 1).
      newAmount - An integer representing the new amount of a product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating that the quantity of the product has been changed successfully.
      Throws:
      ObjectWithInvalidAmount

    • addProductToOrder

      public String addProductToOrder(int amount, int product) throws ObjectOutOfStock, ObjectWithInvalidAmount, ObjectDoesntExists
      This Java function adds a product to an order, updating the product's amount and number of purchases, and throws exceptions if the product doesn't exist, is out of stock, or has an invalid amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of the product that the user wants to add to the order.
      product - The ID of the product being added to the order.
      Returns:
      The method returns a String message indicating whether the product was added to the order correctly or if there was an error (ObjectOutOfStock, ObjectWithInvalidAmount, ObjectDoesntExists).
      Throws:
      ObjectOutOfStock
      ObjectWithInvalidAmount
      ObjectDoesntExists

    • searchProductPosByName

      public int searchProductPosByName(String product)
      The function searches for a product by name in a sorted list of products using binary search.
      Parameters:
      product - The name of the product that needs to be searched in the list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which represents the index of the product in the sorted list of products that matches the given product name. If the product is not found, it will return a negative value.

    • searchExactProductByName

      public String searchExactProductByName(String min, String max, boolean minToMax)
      The function searches for a product within a given range of names and returns the result or an error message.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value to search for in the range of product names.
      max - The maximum string length to consider when searching for products by name.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search should be performed from the minimum value to the maximum value (true) or from the maximum value to the minimum value (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String.

    • searchProductByName

      public String searchProductByName(String min, String max, boolean minToMax, boolean preffix)
      The function searches for products within a specified range of names, either by prefix or suffix, and returns the results in a formatted string.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum string value to search for in the product names.
      max - The maximum string value to search for in the product names.
      minToMax - A boolean value indicating whether the search should be performed from the minimum value to the maximum value (true) or from the maximum value to the minimum value (false).
      preffix - A boolean value indicating whether the search should be based on the prefix of the product name or the suffix. If true, the search will be based on the prefix; if false, it will be based on the suffix.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that represents the result of a search for products within a certain range of names, based on the parameters passed to the method. The String contains information about the products found, including their names and prices.

    • searchProductsByPrice

      public String searchProductsByPrice(Double min, Double max, boolean minToMax)
      This function searches for products within a price range and returns them in either ascending or descending order based on their price.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum price value to search for products.
      max - The maximum price of the products to be searched.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the products should be sorted from minimum to maximum price (true) or from maximum to minimum price (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains the information of the products that meet the price range criteria, sorted either from lowest to highest price or from highest to lowest price, depending on the value of the boolean parameter "minToMax".

    • searchProductByStock

      public String searchProductByStock(int min, int max, boolean minToMax)
      The function searches for products within a specified stock range and returns them in either ascending or descending order based on the boolean input.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum amount of stock that a product should have to be included in the search.
      max - The maximum amount of stock that the user wants to search for.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search results should be sorted from minimum to maximum or from maximum to minimum. If it is true, the results will be sorted from minimum to maximum, and if it is false, the results will be sorted from maximum to minimum.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains the information of the products that have a stock amount within the specified range (min and max). The order of the products in the returned String depends on the value of the boolean parameter minToMax. If it is true, the products are sorted from the one with the lowest stock amount to the one with the highest stock amount. If it is false, the

    • searchProductBySells

      public String searchProductBySells(int min, int max, boolean minToMax)
      This Java function searches for products within a specified range of number of purchases and returns them in either ascending or descending order based on a boolean parameter.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum number of purchases a product must have to be included in the search.
      max - The maximum number of purchases a product can have to be included in the search results.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search results should be sorted from minimum to maximum (true) or from maximum to minimum (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains the information of the products that have a number of purchases within a certain range, sorted either from lowest to highest or from highest to lowest, depending on the value of the boolean parameter "minToMax".

    • searchProductByCategory

      public String searchProductByCategory(Integer min, Integer max, boolean minToMax)
      This function searches for products within a specified category range and returns a string message with the matching products.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value of the range to search for products by category.
      max - The maximum value of the range to search for products by category.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search should be performed from the minimum value to the maximum value (true) or from the maximum value to the minimum value (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains a message with the products that match the given category range. If there are no products that match the range, the method returns a message indicating that there are no elements on this range.

    • searchOrderByTotalPrice

      public String searchOrderByTotalPrice(Double min, Double max, boolean minToMax)
      The function sorts a list of orders by price, searches for orders within a given price range, and returns a string representation of the orders in either ascending or descending order based on a boolean parameter.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum price value to search for in the list of orders.
      max - The maximum price limit for the orders to be searched.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search results should be sorted from minimum to maximum price (true) or from maximum to minimum price (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains the orders within a given price range, sorted either from lowest to highest or from highest to lowest, depending on the value of the boolean parameter "minToMax".

    • searchOrderByDate

      public String searchOrderByDate(Date min, Date max, boolean minToMax)
      The function searches for orders within a given date range and returns them in either ascending or descending order.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum date to search for orders.
      max - The maximum date to search for orders.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search results should be sorted in ascending order (true) or descending order (false) based on the order date.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string that contains the orders within the specified date range, sorted either from earliest to latest or from latest to earliest, depending on the value of the boolean parameter `minToMax`.

    • searchExactOrderByBuyerName

      public String searchExactOrderByBuyerName(String min, String max, boolean minToMax)
      This Java function searches for orders in a given range of buyer names and returns them in a specified order.
      Parameters:
      min - A string representing the minimum value to search for in the buyer names.
      max - The maximum value to search for in the range. It is used in the binary search algorithm to find the upper bound of the range.
      minToMax - A boolean value that determines whether the search should be sorted from minimum to maximum (true) or from maximum to minimum (false).
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String.

    • searchOrderByBuyerName

      public String searchOrderByBuyerName(String min, String max, boolean minToMax, boolean preffix)
      This Java function searches for orders by buyer name within a given range, either by prefix or suffix, and returns the results in a specified order.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value to search for in the buyer name.
      max - The maximum value to search for in the buyer name.
      minToMax - A boolean value indicating whether the search results should be sorted from minimum to maximum (true) or from maximum to minimum (false).
      preffix - A boolean value indicating whether the search should be based on the prefix of the buyer name or the suffix. If true, the search will be based on the prefix; if false, it will be based on the suffix.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that represents the result of a search for orders by buyer name within a given range. The search can be performed by prefix or suffix, and the results can be sorted in ascending or descending order. The returned String contains information about the orders that match the search criteria.

    • printInRange

      public String printInRange(ArrayList<Integer> position, boolean minToMax, boolean isProduct)
      This function takes in an ArrayList of integers representing positions, a boolean indicating whether to print in ascending or descending order, and a boolean indicating whether to print products or orders, and returns a string containing the corresponding products or orders in the specified order.
      Parameters:
      position - An ArrayList of integers representing the positions of elements to be printed.
      minToMax - A boolean value indicating whether the elements should be printed in ascending order (true) or descending order (false).
      isProduct - A boolean value indicating whether the elements in the ArrayList are products or orders. If true, the method will print information about products. If false, it will print information about orders.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains a message with the elements within a given range of an ArrayList, either in ascending or descending order, and either as products or orders, depending on the parameters passed to the method.
